content.en: Algorithmic Glaucoma Diagnosis: Researchers are investigating the use of algorithms in scanning laser polarimetry to improve the diagnosis and assessment of glaucoma. These algorithms, such as customised corneal polarisation compensation and variable corneal polarization compensation, aim to compensate for changes induced by LASIK and enhance the accuracy of measurements. By comparing retinal nerve fiber layer thickness and visual field sensitivity, these algorithms can potentially detect glaucoma and assess the structure-function relationship between retinal sensitivity and retinal nerve fiber layer thickness.
content.da: Algoritmisk Glaukomdiagnose: Forskere undersøger brugen af algoritmer i scanning laser polarimetri for at forbedre diagnosen og vurderingen af glaukom. Disse algoritmer, såsom tilpasset korneal polarisationskompensation og variabel korneal polarisationskompensation, sigter mod at kompensere for ændringer fremkaldt af LASIK og forbedre målenøjagtigheden. Ved at sammenligne tykkelsen af det retinale nervefiberlag og følsomheden i synsfeltet kan disse algoritmer potentielt opdage glaukom og vurdere struktur-funktionsforholdet mellem retinal følsomhed og tykkelsen af det retinale nervefiberlag.
